[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [BCS Deserialization] Does convert_bcs_hex handle BCS deserialization errors consistently across different type branches, or can type-specific failures cause non-deterministic indexing behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [Type Confusion Attack] Can attackers craft BCS-encoded data where declared type (e.g., 'u64') doesn't match actual encoded type, causing convert_bcs_hex to produce incorrect values and corrupt indexed numeric data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [String Type Bypass] Does the '0x1::string::String' type check in convert_bcs_hex properly validate Move string format, or can alternative string type paths bypass this check allowing unvalidated string data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [Address Validation] Does convert_bcs_hex validate that BCS-decoded addresses are valid Aptos addresses (32 bytes), or can malformed addresses cause crashes in downstream address processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [Default Fallback] Can the default case returning original value allow completely invalid BCS data to be stored when type is unrecognized, causing data integrity issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex()] [Hex Prefix Handling] Does strip_prefix('0x') in convert_bcs_hex handle edge cases like '0X' (uppercase) or multiple prefixes '0x0x', potentially causing hex decode failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Type Code Range] Does convert_bcs_hex_new validate that type codes are within valid range (0-9), or can out-of-range type codes (10+) bypass validation and default to returning original malformed value? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [U256 BigDecimal] Can BCS deserialization of u256 values (type code 6) as BigDecimal cause precision loss or overflow when values exceed BigDecimal's representation limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Byte Vector Format] Does the byte_vector case (type 8) properly encode output as '0x{hex}', or can byte vectors with special characters cause formatting issues in indexed data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Type Mismatch] Can attackers provide type code 4 (u64) with BCS data encoding a u128, causing truncation or incorrect value interpretation in convert_bcs_hex_new? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [String UTF-8] Does convert_bcs_hex_new validate UTF-8 encoding for type 9 (string) after BCS deserialization, or can invalid UTF-8 sequences be stored in database? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Bool Representation] Can non-standard bool BCS encodings (values other than 0x00/0x01) bypass validation in type code 0, causing incorrect boolean values in indexed properties? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Integer Overflow Display] Can extremely large u128/u256 values cause integer overflow when converted to string via to_string() method in convert_bcs_hex_new? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_hex_new()] [Address Canonicalization] Does convert_bcs_hex_new (type 7) standardize address format consistently with standardize_address(), or can inconsistent address formats cause duplicate entries in indexed data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_propertymap()] [None Handling] Does convert_bcs_propertymap return None when PropertyMap::from_bcs_encode_str fails, causing silent data loss in property map indexing without error logging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_propertymap()] [Serialization Failure] Can serde_json::to_value() fail in convert_bcs_propertymap when PropertyMap contains non-serializable types, returning None and dropping valid property data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_propertymap()] [Recursive Dependency] Does convert_bcs_propertymap handle circular references in PropertyMap structures, or can recursive property maps cause infinite loops during conversion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_token_object_propertymap()] [None Return] Does convert_bcs_token_object_propertymap returning None cause token object metadata to be completely missing from index, breaking NFT discovery and marketplace functionality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_token_object_propertymap()] [Type Conversion Error] Can failures in TokenObjectPropertyMap::from_bcs_encode_str cause inconsistent property map formats across different token objects in the same collection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_bcs_token_object_propertymap()] [Serialization Edge Cases] Does serde_json::to_value handle all possible TokenObjectPropertyMap variants, or can edge cases cause serialization to return None silently? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_hex()] [UTF-8 Validation] Does convert_hex validate UTF-8 encoding after hex decoding via String::from_utf8, or can malformed UTF-8 byte sequences return None causing data loss in indexed strings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/util.rs] [Function: convert_hex()] [Hex Decode Error] Can invalid hex characters in input cause hex::decode to return error, leading to None return value and silent data loss in convert_hex? (Medium)
